channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Climate change: M4 drivers asked for views on tolls for older cars
item.description: A Welsh Government survey asks for views on tolls for older cars on two of Wales' busiest roads.

item.title: Climate: Disposable barbecues a modern menace, says Tory
item.description: Party's climate spokesperson urges shops to ditch the products for health and environmental reasons.

item.title: Second homes: Rising price fears amid holiday home plan
item.description: Plans to change a former school into holiday lets prompts fears locals cannot buy homes.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Crowds line streets for Caerphilly homecoming
item.description: Boxer Lauren Price won gold and Lauren Williams won silver in the women's -67kg taekwondo in Tokyo.

item.title: M4 reopens between Swansea and Llanelli after closure
item.description: The M4 was closed in both directions to allow the air ambulance to land after a "serious incident".

item.title: Recycling: Bin delays blamed on Covid and driver shortage
item.description: Some people across Wales are complaining their bins have not been collected for weeks.

item.title: Dyfed-Powys Police officer stole van battery after crash
item.description: Oliver George West, 31, stole the battery from the scene of the crash and took it home.

item.title: Barry death: Man, 53, arrested on suspicion of murder
item.description: Police say a man died suddenly in a property in the early hours of Friday.

item.title: Covid: Care home diary reveals lockdown isolation
item.description: A 94-year-old's diary of life at a care home during the pandemic is turned into a book.

item.title: Newport County: League Two side severely hit by Covid outbreak
item.description: Newport County manager Mike Flynn says his squad has been hit by an outbreak of Covid-19 with four positive tests and close contacts in isolation.

item.title: Cancer: Man urges check-ins on friends with disease
item.description: Cobi Flowers says his friends did not know how to react to his diagnosis when he told them.

item.title: Covid: Diary records how pandemic changed care home life
item.description: A former journalist writes a diary of his experiences during lockdown, including being in hospital.

item.title: Caerphilly fire: Firefighters tackle blaze at recycling plant
item.description: The fire service said the blaze involved 200 tonnes of metal and was "well developed".

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: 15-year-old Cardiff sprinter with big dreams
item.description: Sprinter Tomi Roberts-Jones has cerebral palsy and, aged 15, has already represented Wales.

item.title: Carer shortage leaves Wrexham man 'stranded' in hospital
item.description: Gwyneth Taylor's husband Ronald is unable to go home because of a shortage of carers.

item.title: Drugs: The county lines gang in our Powys cul-de-sac
item.description: What happens when drug dealers move in to a small, rural town?

item.title: Climate change: Meet the people taking action
item.description: A goods swap shop and DIY flood defenders are just some ideas people have put into practice.

item.title: Ellis Jenkins: Wales flanker makes injury comeback for Cardiff at Harlequins
item.description: Wales flanker Ellis Jenkins will make a second comeback from long-term injury in Cardiff's pre-season game at Harlequins on Saturday.

item.title: WillGriff John: 'Genetically gifted' Scarlets prop aims to power into Welsh side
item.description: WillGriff John is the "genetically gifted" prop aiming to win his first Wales cap this season after being denied his Test debut by Covid-19.

item.title: UFC Fight Night 191: Bantamweight Jack Shore targets win for top 15 UFC shot
item.description: Jack Shore hopes a win against Liudvik Sholinian in UFC Fight Night 191 will give him a shot at a top-15 opponent.

item.title: Glamorgan Cricket: County sign Somerset batsman Ed Byrom
item.description: Glamorgan sign Somerset batsman Ed Byrom on a two-year deal, with an immediate move on loan ahead of their match at Durham.

item.title: Jordan Olowofela: Dragons sign Leicester Tigers wing on loan
item.description: Dragons sign wing Jordan Olowofela on loan from Leicester Tigers for the 2021-22 season.

item.title: Codi tollau ffyrdd yn cael 'effaith andwyol ar y tlotaf'
item.description: Pryder am effaith codi tollau ar rannau o ffyrdd ger Pontypridd a Chasnewydd ar bobl difreintiedig cymdeithas.

item.title: Ymchwiliad llofruddiaeth wedi 'marwolaeth annisgwyl'
item.description: Mae dyn 53 oed wedi cael ei arestio ar amheuaeth o lofruddiaeth wedi marwolaeth dyn yn Y Barri.

item.title: Cynllun i droi hen ysgol yn llety gwyliau'n codi cynnen
item.description: Trigolion lleol yn gwrthwynebu cais i droi hen ysgol Rowen yn llety gwyliau moethus.

item.title: 3 Llun: Lluniau pwysicaf bywyd Iolo Williams
item.description: Pa ffotograffau yw'r rhai mwyaf arwyddocaol i'r naturiaethwr?

item.title: Chwarae da ond dim goliau i Gymru yn erbyn Y Ffindir
item.description: Methodd Harry Wilson gic o'r smotyn wrth i Gymru baratoi ar gyfer gemau nesaf ymgyrch Cwpan y Byd 2022.
